item.title: Landscape Aggregation
item.description: MGDrive: Landscape Clustering (NCUR Oral Presentation) (Gillian Chu) The idea in this sets of experiments is to understand the differences in dynamics of the spread of gene drives in spatiotemporal landscapes, and how these dynamics are affected when we increase the aggregation (clustering) level of the breeding sites. The main goal is to determine a metric of information loss that we can use in the specific context of gene flows in mosquito populations.
